body: This is related to, but not the same symptoms as, https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/10596.
Urg. That's going to be painful...
I have figured out a fix for the path truncation issue, I'll upload it tomorrow.  The #10596 issue I think I've got a handle on as well.
Wow, I guess I didn't really expect it to update this bug for every force push to that branch.  Apologies for the noise!

I'm seeing a similar failure mode - is this the same issue?

Bazel version 0.5.3 on Ubuntu 16.04

My workspace contains effectively the following:

```
# ...some entries omitted above here
bind(
    name = "gflags",
    actual = "@com_github_gflags_gflags//:gflags",
)

git_repository(
    name = "com_google_protobuf",
    commit = "80a37e0",
    remote = "https://github.com/google/protobuf",
)

bind(
    name = "protobuf",
    actual = "@com_google_protobuf//:protobuf",
)

bind(
    name = "protocol_compiler",
    actual = "@com_google_protobuf//:protoc",
)

bind(
    name = "protobuf_clib",
    actual = "@com_google_protobuf//:protoc_lib",
)

git_repository(
    name = "boringssl",
    commit = "87ab749",
    remote = "https://boringssl.googlesource.com/boringssl",
)

bind(
    name = "libssl",
    actual = "@boringssl//:ssl",
)

git_repository(
    name = "org_pubref_rules_protobuf",
    commit = "4af9492",
    remote = "https://github.com/pubref/rules_protobuf",
)

new_git_repository(
    name = "com_github_madler_zlib",
    build_file = "zlib.BUILD",
    commit = "5089329",
    remote = "https://github.com/madler/zlib",
)

new_local_repository(
   # This is checked out locally because it needs ./configure ran to generate a header file
    name = "com_github_cares_cares",
    #build_file = "cares.BUILD",  # Actual file is external/cares.BUILD
    build_file = "external/cares.BUILD",  # Actual file is external/cares.BUILD
    #commit = "3be1924",
    #remote = "https://github.com/c-ares/c-ares",
    path = "/home/scott.minor-local/tmp/c-ares",
)

bind(
    name = "cares",
    actual = "@com_github_cares_cares//:ares",
)

git_repository(
    name = "com_github_grpc_grpc",
    # TODO: Update this commit to the latest possible
    commit = "29a2a53",
    remote = "https://github.com/grpc/grpc",
)
```

My results from trying to build `grpc++_reflection`:

```
INFO: Reading 'startup' options from >>REDACTED<<: --output_base=/tmp/bazel
Loading: 
Loading: 0 packages loaded
INFO: Analysed target @com_github_grpc_grpc//:grpc++_reflection (0 packages loaded).
INFO: Found 1 target...
[0 / 1] BazelWorkspaceStatusAction stable-status.txt
ERROR: /tmp/bazel/external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/BUILD:36:1: output 'external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/reflection.pb.h' was not created
ERROR: /tmp/bazel/external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/BUILD:36:1: output 'external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/reflection.pb.cc' was not created
ERROR: /tmp/bazel/external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/BUILD:36:1: not all outputs were created or valid
Target @com_github_grpc_grpc//:grpc++_reflection failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
INFO: Elapsed time: 1.177s, Critical Path: 0.74s
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully
```

I can see that it indeed generates files at `external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha`, and that this is a more sensible path than `external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha`. Although my path looks malformed, it does not look mangled like OP's - it has some elements duplicated instead. Is this the same/related issue?
It could just be mangled on a path separator boundary.

> It could just be mangled on a path separator boundary.
Agreed.

If I change my WORKSPACE to point to @gkelly's fork and pin it to commit `aed0624` that has the fix, I can build up to this point:

```
INFO: Reading 'startup' options from >>REDACTED<<: --output_base=/tmp/bazel
Loading: 
Loading: 0 packages loaded
INFO: Analysed target @com_github_grpc_grpc//:grpc++_reflection (0 packages loaded).
INFO: Found 1 target...
[0 / 1] BazelWorkspaceStatusAction stable-status.txt
ERROR: /tmp/bazel/external/com_github_grpc_grpc/BUILD:1501:1: C++ compilation of rule '@com_github_grpc_grpc//:grpc++_reflection' failed (Exit 1)
In file included from external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/cpp/ext/proto_server_reflection.h:41:0,
                 from external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/cpp/ext/proto_server_reflection.cc:39:
bazel-out/local-fastbuild/genfiles/external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/reflection.grpc.pb.h:39:91: fatal error: external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/reflection.pb.h: No such file or directory
 #include "external/com_github_grpc_grpc/src/proto/grpc/reflection/v1alpha/reflection.pb.h"
                                                                                           ^
compilation terminated.
Target @com_github_grpc_grpc//:grpc++_reflection failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.593s, Critical Path: 0.20s
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully
```

This looks like #10596.
@gkelly , looks like you had a fix for this. Is there a PR for this ?
